Responsible for the contents of the domain leo.org:

Angaben gemäß § 5 TMG

LEO GmbH
Mühlweg 2b
82054 Sauerlach
Germany

Management (Authorised representatives)

Hans Riethmayer
Elmar Bartel

Kontakt

Please note: we cannot offer any support over the telephone. please write an email to us. We will then get in touch with you as quickly as possible. Telefon: +49 (0)8104 909 50 0
Telefax: +49 (0)8104 909 50 290
E-Mail: dict@leo.org

Registereintrag

Eintragung im Handelsregister, Registergericht München
Registernummer: HRB161107

Umsatzsteuer

Umsatzsteuer-Identifikationsnummer gemäß §27 a Umsatzsteuergesetz: DE814634436

Dispute resolution

The European Commission provides a platform for online dispute resolution (ODR):https://ec.europa.eu/consumers/odr 
You will find our email address in the Legal info.

We are not currently involved in any dispute-resolution proceedings before a consumer arbitration board.

Liability for content

Under §7 para. 1 TMG (German Telemedia Act) we, as the service provider, are responsible for our own content on these pages in accordance with the general laws. However, under §§ 8 to 10 of the Act (TMG) we, as the service provider, are not obliged to monitor transmitted or stored information from third parties or to search for circumstances that indicate illegal activity.

Obligations to remove or block the use of information in accordance with general laws remain unaffected. However, liability in this respect is only possible from the time of knowledge of a specific infringement.  Once we become aware of any such legal violations, we will remove the content immediately.

Liability for links

Our service contains links to external, third-party websites over whose content we have no influence. Accordingly, we cannot assume any liability for this content. The content of linked pages always remains the liability of the respective provider or operator of the webpages. Linked pages were checked for possible legal violation at the time the link was established. No illegal content was recognisable at the time the links were established.

Permanent monitoring of the content of a linked page cannot be considered reasonable without a specific indication of a violation of the law. If we become aware of any infringements, we will remove such links immediately.

Copyright

The content and creations produced by the website operator on these webpages are subject to German copyright laws. The duplication, editing, distribution and any kind of utilization beyond the provisions of copyright law require the written consent of the author or creator concerned. Downloads and copies of texts created by LEO are permitted for private use only, not for commercial exploitation. Downloads and copies of images are not permitted.

Insofar as the content of these pages is not created by the operator, the copyrights of third parties are respected. In particular, the content provided by third parties is identified as such. Should you, however, become aware of an infringement of copyright, you are asked to draw this to our attention, for example by e-mail (see above). Once we are aware of an infringement of rights, we will remove the content in question immediately.

Mühlweg 2b
82054 Sauerlach

IBAN: DE41 7019 0000 0000 2930 32
BIC: GENODEF1M01 Donate via PayPalPlease note: Contributions to LEO GmbH are not tax deductible.AdvertisingSupport LEO:Make a donationPrivacy PolicyTable of contents
  1. Data protection
  2. Preliminary remarks
  3. Use of LEO
  4. Registration / User account at LEO
  5. Use of the forums
  6. Use of the Trainer
  7. Reporting mistakes
  8. Emails to LEO
  9. Your rights
  10. Legal Validity
Data protectionPreliminary remarks

The use of our services automatically implies that you have expressed your agreement with our Privacy Policy as summarised below.

This Privacy Policy is complemented by our Conditions of use. As the name suggests, this lays down the conditions under which you may use the LEO website and services.

None of the data stored by LEO is forwarded or sold to third parties.

Your data is stored on servers which are owned by and belong to LEO GmbH. These servers are located in Germany.

Use of LEO

Irrespective of your use of the LEO website and services, you are able to change your data protection settings at any time:edit. Please note that these settings are only valid for the currently used browser and they are not retained if, for example, you reset your browser to the default factory settings or if you delete all the cookies.

Use of the LEO website through a web browser (Firefox, Chrome, Internet Explorer, EDGE, Vivaldi, etc.) without registration / user account
  • Information about the cookies used is to be found in Data-protection settings. The cookie-settings are checked and stored by our partner CookiePro by OneTrust. Further information about conformity with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) as well as the Privacy Notice and the Cookie-Notice issued by CookiePro by OneTrust are also available to you there.
  • Depending on your use of the services offered by LEO, the following cookies may be stored
    • "trainer": stores data about the tips which have already been displayed in the Trainer. This cookie is deleted after 10,000 days.
    • "config": stores data about whether the user wants to receive tips for the solution of specific practice tasks. The cookie is only stored if the user does not wish to receive these tips. This cookie is deleted after 10,000 days.
    • "contentSolveHelp": stores data about whether a language-course user has already seen specific tips or whether the user generally does not wish to see the tips. The cookie is only stored if you are a language-course user. This cookie is deleted after 10,000 days.
    These data are stored and/or processed in accordance with Article 6, para. 1, sent. (b) of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
  • We use Google Analytics on a large number of our web pages, and this in turn means that Google stores cookies on our users’ computers and records IP addresses visited. To find out more about this, please consult the Google Privacy Policy .You can prevent the recording of data about your use of the website by Google by downloading and installing the browser plug-in available at the following link: https://tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout
    • These data are stored and/or processed in accordance with Article 6, para. 1, sent. (b) of the GDPR. This legal provision permits the processing of personal data by the controller (in this case LEO) when there is a “legitimate interest” which does not come into conflict with a user’s overriding interests. Our legitimate interest consists in the financing of the operation of our websites and apps. Both of these contain extensively researched information which we provide to a large extent free of charge. The marketing of the advertising spaces on our pages enables us to continue to offer these website and app services and to make them available to everyone in this form and, in this way, to make a significant contribution to the dissemination of knowledge.Advertising

    To the extent that we make advertising directly available, this is done by means of a link to the specific advertiser’s own website. In this process LEO does not deposit any cookies or record any personal data of any kind.

    Advertising which we do not make available directly is provided by diva-e Digital Value Excellence GmbH, Tempelhofer Weg 44, 10829 Berlin. In order to optimise the advertising materials used, diva-e and its advertising partners make use of cookies.

    By using the following links, you can opt out of cookies used by third parties acting on our behalf:

    • Google Doubleclick
    • Appnexus
    • Rubicon
    • Amazon
    • Criteo GmbH
    • OpenX
    • Index Exchange Inc.
    • Pubmatic Inc.
    • Yieldlab AG

    Irrespective of your use of the LEO website and services, you are able to change your data protection settings at any time:edit. Please note that these settings are only valid for the currently used browser and they are not retained if, for example, you reset your browser to the default factory settings or if you delete all the cookies.

    LEO also permits other companies (e.g. media agencies) to use cookies to measure the success of advertising and to analyse online advertising and content in order to optimise the advertising you are shown when using our online services. It is possible to . check your current status and activate or deactivate the collection and storing of your personal details by these companies. This consumer portal also provides further information on the subject of behavioural online advertising.

    Please note that if you are using a new computer or a different web browser, or if you have deleted the opt-out cookie from your data storage medium, you will have to go through the opt-out process again.

    These data are stored and/or processed in accordance with Article 6, para. 1, sent. (b) of the GDPR. This legal provision permits the processing of personal data by the controller (in this case LEO) when there is a “legitimate interest” which does not come into conflict with a user’s overriding interests. Our legitimate interest consists in the financing of the operation of our websites and apps. Both of these contain extensively researched information which we provide to a large extent free of charge. The marketing of the advertising spaces on our pages enables us to continue to offer these website and app services and to make them available to everyone in this form and, in this way, to make a significant contribution to the dissemination of knowledge.

    In order to tailor the website to your approximate location (e.g. to select appropriate language settings), your IP address is transmitted to Cloudflare and the service provider of the "cookie banner", OneTrust Technology Limited. Further information about this and the applicable legal basis are to be found at CookiePro as well as at Cloudflare.

Use of LEO through a web browser (Firefox, Chrome, Internet Explorer, EDGE, Vivaldi, etc.) with log in / user account

If you register with LEO and are logged on, the following additional data is recorded / transmitted / stored

  • The following cookies may be stored:
    • "token":contains a random series of letters and numbers to make an automatic log on possible. This cookie is only deposited if you selected the option 'Remember me' when you logged on. The cookie is automatically deleted after 365 days.
    • "activeToken":stores a version number for the automatic log in. This cookie is only deposited if you did not select the ‘Remember me’ option when you logged in. The cookie is deleted as soon as you log out. The cookie is automatically deleted after 365 days.
    • "neverautologin": stores a default setting indicating that you do not wish to have any automatic log in within this particular browser. The cookie is only deposited if you have once expressed the wish to have no automatic log in. The cookie is deleted after 10,000 days.
    The cookies and the data they contain are not forwarded to third parties.
    These data are stored and/or processed in accordance with Article 6, para. 1, sent. (b) of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
  • If you make use of our language courses or our trainer, you learning progress (e.g. completion of individual lessons and units, results of vocabulary testing exercises) is stored. These data are stored and/or processed in accordance with Article 6, para. 1, sent. (b) of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
  • If you write a contribution to our forum discussions, the content of your contribution is stored and is linked to your user account. These data are stored and/or processed in accordance with Article 6, para. 1, sent. (b) of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
Use of LEO through the APP without log in / user account
  • When the APP is used for the first time on a device, the following data are permanently stored:
    • Date and time
    • The number of the app version
    • Device ID (a randomly composed series of characters)
    These data are not forwarded or sold to third parties.
    These data are stored and/or processed in accordance with Article 6, para. 1, sent. (b) of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
  • Whenever a search is made, the search term(s) and the device ID are transmitted but are stored only temporarily for seven days for the purpose of finding errors and remedying them.
    These data are stored and/or processed in accordance with Article 6, para. 1, sent. (b) of the GDPR. This legal provision permits the processing of personal data by the controller (in this case LEO) when there is a “legitimate interest” which does not come into conflict with a user’s overriding interests. Our legitimate interest consists in the financing of the operation of our websites and apps. Both of these contain extensively researched information which we provide to a large extent free of charge. The marketing of the advertising spaces on our pages enables us to continue to offer these website and app services and to make them available to everyone in this form and, in this way, to make a significant contribution to the dissemination of knowledge.
Use of LEO through the APP with log in / user account
  • If you log in to the APP with your user name and password, the following data are linked:
    • The device ID is linked to your user account.
    • If you buy a language course in the APP-Store (iOS) or the Play-Store (Android), the order number is linked to your user account
    • If you use our language courses or the Trainer, your learning progress (e.g. completion of individual lessons and units, results of vocabulary testing exercises) is stored.
    These data are stored and/or processed in accordance with Article 6, para. 1, sent. (b) of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
Registration / User account at LEO

When you create a free user account with LEO, for example in order to write contributions for the forums, to buy a language course or to use the Trainer for your personal vocabulary training, the following data are collected and stored upon registration:

  • User name: can be freely chosen, is not visible to other users
  • Alias (nick name): can be freely chosen, is possibly visible to other users (e.g. if you write a contribution for the forum)
  • Email address: is used for the confirmation (verification) of the log in. Is only visible to other users if you give your explicit consent and the appropriate settings are made in your account. You can change your email address in your account settings at any time. The email address provided upon initial registration remains stored in unchanged form. We do not give your email address to third parties and we do not send newsletters.
  • LEO messages (“Private messages”): stores your wish to receive or not to receive personal messages from other users within LEO. You can change this wish at any time by adjusting your account settings. The private messages are stored permanently on our servers. Your email address is not visible to other users of the private messages facility/service.

We do not forward the data collected upon registration to third parties.
These data are stored and/or processed in accordance with Article 6, para. 1, sent. (b) of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

Upon creation of a user account, the standard settings for the Trainer are automatically linked to the user account. in this process the following data are stored:

  • Test volume: lays down how many vocabulary items you normally want to be tested on per questioning session.
  • Test direction: lays down which language is to be given and which is to be tested.
  • Strictness: lays down how strictly the checking of the answer you provide is to be evaluated (e.g. in the testing method "write").
  • Vocabulary items automatically deleted: lays down in two ways whether the vocabulary item should be removed from the collection, either on the basis of absolute values (“known X times in succession”) or on the basis of a percentual value (“tested at least Z times and known in Y% of the cases”) or on the basis of a combination of these two variants.

You can change these settings before each testing session or permanently in your user account. These data are not visible to third parties.
These data are stored and/or processed in accordance with Article 6, para. 1, sent. (b) of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

In your user account you can provide additional details of your own free will: family name, first name, address (street, town, postcode, region, country), occupation, language-related information (free text), knowledge of the individual languages (level, region, native language) offered by LEO. Language-related details and knowledge of languages (to the extent that these are provided) are always visible to the public. the other details voluntarily provided can be made visible to others or not, as you wish.
These data are stored and/or processed in accordance with Article 6, para. 1, sent. (b) of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

We store the date of your registration and the most recent log in to LEO.
These data are stored and/or processed in accordance with Article 6, para. 1, sent. (b) of the GDPR. This legal provision permits the processing of personal data by the controller (in this case LEO) when there is a “legitimate interest” which does not come into conflict with a user’s overriding interests. Our legitimate interest consists in the financing of the operation of our websites and apps. Both of these contain extensively researched information which we provide to a large extent free of charge. The marketing of the advertising spaces on our pages enables us to continue to offer these website and app services and to make them available to everyone in this form and, in this way, to make a significant contribution to the dissemination of knowledge.

Storage duration

The data of the user account remain stored permanently at LEO. You can request the deletion of the data at any time (see “Right to deletion”).

Use of the forums

With regard to the use of LEO’s forums, data are not stored until you start to take an active part in the forum activities, e.g. when you start a new thread by writing a question or you respond to another user's question (“contribution”). If you only read the contributions in the forums, no data about you is stored.

Every user who makes a contribution to one of our forums, gives his or her irrevocable consent to the permanent publication of this contribution in the forum concerned. The user, however, has no entitlement vis-à-vis LEO to have his or her contributions published in a forum.
These data are stored and/or processed in accordance with Article 6, para. 1, sent. (b) of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

When you write a contribution for a forum, the IP address assigned to your internet connection at that time is stored. The IP address is stored for a maximum of 29 days and is only forwarded to the authorities concerned if the authorities are prosecuting an offence.
These data are stored and/or processed in accordance with Article 6, para. 1, sent. (b) of the GDPR.

Contributions you make to the forums appear exclusively under your alias. other forum users are thus unable to connect these to your person. The deletion of your account removes all your personal data, but this does not include contributions to the forum which are published anonymously and are thus not connected to your person. If these contributions were to be removed, it would have a distorting effect on the forum discussions and would deprive the contributions made by other users, or their comments on your contribution, of their sense and context.
These data are stored and/or processed in accordance with Article 6, para. 1, sent. (b) of the GDPR. This legal provision permits the processing of personal data by the controller (in this case LEO) when there is a “legitimate interest” which does not come into conflict with a user’s overriding interests. Our legitimate interest consists in the financing of the operation of our websites and apps. Both of these contain extensively researched information which we provide to a large extent free of charge. The marketing of the advertising spaces on our pages enables us to continue to offer these website and app services and to make them available to everyone in this form and, in this way, to make a significant contribution to the dissemination of knowledge.

When you "subscribe" to a contribution in a forum in order to be notified about new responses, we store the following data in your user account:

  • the discussion in question
  • the mode in which you wish to be notified (only on the LEO page or by email)
  • whether you have read the discussion since the last notification was sent
These data are stored and/or processed in accordance with Article 6, para. 1, sent. (b) of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

Use of the Trainer

When you use the Trainer, the following data are stored (depending on the way it is used):

  • Your collection of vocabulary items
    These data are stored and/or processed in accordance with Article 6, para. 1, sent. (b) of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
  • The testing statistics of all vocabulary items on which you test yourself regardless of whether these are vocabulary items from your own collection or from word lists prepared by LEO or from the word lists of other users. The testing statistics contain:
    • how often you have successfully practised a vocabulary item
    • how often you have not successfully practised a vocabulary item
    • how often in succession you have successfully or not successfully practised vocabulary item
    • when you last practised a vocabulary item

    These data are stored and/or processed in accordance with Article 6, para. 1, sent. (b) of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
  • If you compose word lists, these word lists are linked to your user account and the assignment of your vocabulary items to your word lists is stored.
    These data are stored and/or processed in accordance with Article 6, para. 1, sent. (b) of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
  • If you compose folders, the folders are linked to your user account and the assignment of word lists to folders and folders to folders is stored.
    These data are stored and/or processed in accordance with Article 6, para. 1, sent. (b) of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
  • If you initiate a learning group, the group is linked to your user account.
    These data are stored and/or processed in accordance with Article 6, para. 1, sent. (b) of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

Use of groups in the Trainer

If you initiate a learning group or are a participant in such a learning group, other users can possibly learn your word lists. You can decide for yourself which of your folders or word lists you want to share with other group members. By releasing a word list or a folder, or any number of them, you give LEO permission to make all these items available to other group members.
These data are stored and/or processed in accordance with Article 6, para. 1, sent. (b) of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

Automatic evaluation of learning progress

In order to offer you appropriate vocabulary items for you to practise and learn whenever you decide to use the Trainer, your earlier vocabulary-learning successes are analysed by our system. This analysis determines a number of vocabulary items and proposes these to you for practice.
These data are stored and/or processed in accordance with Article 6, para. 1, sent. (b) of the GDPR. This legal provision permits the processing of personal data by the controller (in this case LEO) when there is a “legitimate interest” which does not come into conflict with a user’s overriding interests. Our legitimate interest consists in the financing of the operation of our websites and apps. Both of these contain extensively researched information which we provide to a large extent free of charge. The marketing of the advertising spaces on our pages enables us to continue to offer these website and app services and to make them available to everyone in this form and, in this way, to make a significant contribution to the dissemination of knowledge.

Reporting mistakes

When you use our prescribed form for submitting details about content errors  . technical problems , the data you provide in the form is stored for only as long as we need to process your submission and to remedy the problem. After your submission has been dealt with, the data are automatically deleted. If you wish, you can also have the data deleted earlier by sending us a written request to this effect by email.
These data are stored and/or processed in accordance with Article 6, para. 1, sent. (b) of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

Emails to LEO

If you send an email to the LEO team or to an individual LEO employee, this email will be stored permanently. Your communications are only used to deal with your concern as quickly as possible. In order to give a more comprehensive reply to any subsequent follow-up questions about the same or different subjects, we keep a record of your emails. If you wish to have your email(s) deleted, please send a further email to this effect (this email will also be deleted, of course). We do not send out any newsletters and we do not pass on your email address to third parties.
These data are stored and/or processed in accordance with Article 6, para. 1, sent. (b) of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

Your rights Right to rectification

Under Art. 16 GDPR you have the right to have the data stored by LEO rectified. To achieve this, please send an Email to the LEO Team 
We will notify you in accordance with Art. 19 GDPR of the rectification.

Right to erasure (“Right to be forgotten”)

Under Art. 17 GDPR you have the right to have this data erased. If you wish this to be done, please send an Email to the LEO Teamand supply your user name in order to expedite identification
We will notify you in accordance with Art. 19 GDPR of the erasure.

Right to restriction of processing

Under Art. 18 GDPR you have the right to restrict the processing of your data by LEO for a number of specific reasons. If this is your wish, please send an Email to the LEO Team stating your reasons for requesting this restriction of processing.
We will notify you in accordance with Art. 19 GDPR of the restrictions carried out.

Right to data portability / to be informed

On request, we will inform you in accordance with Art. 13 and Art. 20 GDPR whether we have stored personal data about you and what these data are.

For data which are visible in your user account and in the corresponding context, there is an exception to the duty to provide data which we also use in some individual cases. this relates, among others, to:

  • Your forum contributions, since you can already have your own contributions displayed to you, and also the context in which they were made (as, for example, responses to your questions, the questions themselves or other contributions to which you supplied a response). The questions or responses of other users would not be contained in the download.
  • Your entire collection of vocabulary items, since you can have this displayed to you. The data stored in the database comprises exclusively the IDs of the individual translations and not the vocabulary items themselves. The download of your data would thus contain only these IDs, which would make any further use of these data more or less impossible.
  • If you have tested or bought a language course, then your learning progress with relation to the particular course(s) is also available. Since here, once again, the database stores only the IDs of the vocabulary items, exercises and lessons, the content of the exercises would not be contained in the download either.

Right to object

Under Art. 21 Abs. 1 GDPR you have the right to object to the processing of personal data carried out on the strength of Article 6, paragraph 1, sentences (e) or (f). This also applies to profiling on the basis of these provisions. If you wish to object, please send an Email to the LEO Team stating your reasons for requesting this restriction of processing.

Right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority

We also draw your attention to the fact that you, naturally, have the right under Art. 77 GDPR to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority if you consider that the processing of personal data relating to you has been in contravention of the GDPR.

Legal Validity Controller and commissioned data processor

Angaben gemäß § 5 TMG

LEO GmbH
Mühlweg 2b
82054 Sauerlach
Germany

Management (Authorised representatives)

Hans Riethmayer
Elmar Bartel

Kontakt

Please note: we cannot offer any support over the telephone. please write an email to us. We will then get in touch with you as quickly as possible. Telefon: +49 (0)8104 909 50 0
Telefax: +49 (0)8104 909 50 290
E-Mail: dict@leo.org

Registereintrag

Eintragung im Handelsregister, Registergericht München
Registernummer: HRB161107

Umsatzsteuer

Umsatzsteuer-Identifikationsnummer gemäß §27 a Umsatzsteuergesetz: DE814634436

Your data are processed exclusively for the provision of services on our website, in our apps and other services offered by LEO GmbH. The provision of the services offered by LEO GmbH constitutes its legitimate interest in obtaining and processing this data.

The German Version of the Data Protection Declaration is to apply.

Dispute resolution

The European Commission provides a platform for online dispute resolution (ODR):https://ec.europa.eu/consumers/odr 
You will find our email address in the Legal info.

We are not currently involved in any dispute-resolution proceedings before a consumer arbitration board.

Further information is to be found on our Conditions of use page. Dictionary Navigation

IBAN: DE41 7019 0000 0000 2930 32
BIC: GENODEF1M01 Donate via PayPalPlease note: Contributions to LEO GmbH are not tax deductible.AdvertisingSupport LEO:Make a donationConditions of useTable of contents
  1. Use of LEO
  2. Liability
    1. Contents of LEO
    2. Contents offered by third parties
  3. Copyright
    1. Development of toolbars/plug-ins/applets and the like
    2. Links to LEO

    1. New entries for the dictionary
    2. Donating word lists

    3. Policy
    4. Sanctions

  7. Online Courses / General Terms &. Conditions 
  8. Legal Validity
Preliminary remarks

By using our services you automatically agree to our conditions of use as outlined below.

Ergänzt werden die Nutzungsbedingungen durch die Privacy Policy. In dieser ist festgelegt, für welche Angebotsteile von LEO Cookies eingesetzt und in welchem Umfang und in welcher Weise Personendaten erhoben werden. Möchten Sie Angebotsteile nutzen, für die personenbezogene Cookies gesetzt und/oder in denen Personendaten zur Verwendung kommen, so erfragen wir von Ihnen explizit Ihr Einverständnis dafür (Forumsbeiträge, Trainernutzung, Kurse setzen z. B. unabdingbar voraus, dass wir diese mit Ihrer Person koppeln können).

Use of LEO

Use of the services provided by leo.org for private and business purposes is free of charge unless explicit reference is made to costs that will be incurred. Such paid content is primarily limited to subject matter pertaining to language learning (language courses). Users are not permitted to make the LEO services available to third parties in return for payment.

LiabilityContents of LEO

LEO does not accept liability for the correctness of the translations of the words, terms, idiomatic expressions etc. that are provided.

Contents offered by third parties

Links to contents on third-party websites are provided for the purpose of information only. Cross-references and links from LEO to the websites of third parties do not imply that LEO endorses the content on any websites linked or referred to. LEO cannot be held responsible for the subject matter and content on linked websites. This applies to all links displayed on leo.org as well as to all contents of pages accessed via banners and links displayed by LEO and reached via our internet pages. If you are of the opinion that illegal content is contained in any of the web pages linked to, please notify the LEO team.LEO team.

Points of view and opinions put forward by third parties in our forums do not necessarily reflect the opinion of LEO. These expressions of opinion are exclusively the responsibility of their authors. If you are of the opinion that illegal content has been posted in the forums, you are kindly asked to report this to the LEO team (See also Section 6 Forums.)

Copyright

All rights arising in conjunction with the software developed for the purposes of this online service, as well as the databases on which it relies, and all other content belong to LEO GmbH unless another author or proprietor is explicitly named. Any exploitation of the software, the data or any other content except in the form in which it is offered and provided at leo.org is prohibited. In particular, the automatic retrieval of any kind of content via script or in any other manner is forbidden.

Development of toolbars/plug-ins/applets and the like

The development of toolbars/plug-ins/applets and the like (collectively referred to hereinafter as "tools") for internet browsers that are designed to provide direct access to the contents of LEO is permitted only with the prior consent of LEO. Only tools that have been developed with the approval of LEO may be incorporated into internet browsers to provide access to LEO's services.

Tools can only be approved if they carry LEO's name and present the resulting page in exactly the same form as the page for entering a search word that appears on our website dict.leo.org. Approval cannot be granted if advertising displayed on LEO is circumvented by "optimised solutions" that obscure/remove the advertising content.

Links to LEO

Links to LEO services are permitted. However, we expect these links to lead directly to LEO's dictionaries, and the page presenting the link must not contain any illegal or pornographic content. The link to be used is: https://dict.leo.org/

Integrating of a search box in other web sites

LEO consents to the integration of a search box for queries to LEO dictionaries in another web site, on condition that:

  • LEO is named in the search box and it is clearly recognisable that the search box initiates a search in LEO dictionaries,
  • the page presenting the results of a search inquiry is displayed unchanged (possibly in a browser window of its own, but not in a frame of the website providing the link) and, in particular, the advertising shall not be obscured.

Pictures and icons

Most icons used on the LEO website are from the K Desktop Environment ® (a big thanks to this valuable OpenSource project), taken from the Oxygen Icon Set . These icons are published under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported (CC BY-SA 3.0) licence.

All icons that include lions were created specially for LEO, and this is also the case with the following icons, which we were unable to find in the Oxygen Icon Set and which we created as part of this. These icons are also covered by the CC BY-SA 3.0.


Download these icons as zip file.

With a few exceptions, black-and-white icons are from https://materialdesignicons.com/and are published under the SIL Open Font License

In order to display images in a higher resolution, we in some cases use . das JQuery Lightbox Plugin von Leandro Vieira Pinho  

Your participation and contributionsNew entries for the dictionary

LEO welcomes suggestions for new entries provided they are well researched and backed up by reputable sources and/or context examples. You are also asked to read the detailed instructions about creating new entries, which you will find by clicking the . Notes for Users.

The New Entry forum is intended for individual suggestions only. If you would like to submit a whole list of words, the procedure to be followed is explained in the next section.

Donating word lists

If you wish to give us a more extensive collection of words, we will naturally be very happy to hear from you. Please write a brief e-mail to the LEO team so that we can coordinate the procedure. We can only integrate word lists for which you hold the copyright. By submitting the word list, you declare your agreement to transfer your collection of vocabulary items to LEO and permit LEO to make use of the data worldwide as required either directly or through third parties (online and offline). In particular, you agree that LEO may replicate and distribute it in all possible forms (in print, on data carriers or in other media) and may make it available for public access by third parties.

Reporting mistakes

To correct simple spelling mistakes, typos etc., please make use of the Report a mistake form.

If you have doubts about the quality or accuracy of entries in the dictionary and would like to read the opinions of other users, check whether there has already been a discussion on this topic in the forum and, if not, launch a new discussion in the  ‘Wrong entry?’ forum. (Please also read the Forums section below.)

Forums Content and use of the forums

The forums (links: German-English, German-French, German-Spanish, German-Italian, German-Chinese, German-Russian, German-Portuguese, German-Polish) are intended to give you the opportunity to ask questions, provide information, make comments and to publish your views on other matters related to the subject of languages and to discuss these with other users. Participation in the forums is subject to the following conditions of use:

Registration

Participation in the forums must be preceded by Registration, for which a valid email address must be provided. You may, of course, participate in discussions under a pseudonym (nick/alias). Accordingly, registration requires you to choose a login identity as well as a nick/alias. In principle, you can select the same sequence of characters for your nick as for your login. However, for security reasons you are advised to choose a different sequence of characters for your login to avoid giving third parties an easy way of hacking into your account. You are not permitted to take part in the forums using a number of different nicks and thus to appear in seemingly different identities.

Forum policy

Every user who posts a contribution in our forums agrees irrevocably to the publication of this contribution in the forum concerned. However, the user has no entitlement to force LEO to publish their contributions in a forum.

Contributions must be pertinent, in other words, they must refer to the subject of language. LEO is entitled to erase contributions that are not related to the subject of language. The different sections (sub-forums) are arranged into various topics. Before you use a section for the first time, you are asked to read the notes provided about that section (info link just to the right of the section title). This explains the features of this section and gives instructions about how to start a new thread (discussion). Before initiating a new discussion, you should in any case check whether a corresponding discussion has already been launched on the topic in question by using the forum search. If this is not the case, go to the forum start page (Forum home) and click on the heading of the appropriate section. You can then click the “Start new thread” button to start a new discussion.

Discussions in the forums should be conducted in a courteous and objective manner. Substantive criticism, even if it is quite forceful, is of course permitted. However, defamatory criticism and disparaging personal comments or other remarks that contravene applicable German law are not permitted. Insofar as LEO is aware of forum contributions that contravene German law, LEO reserves the right to inform the public prosecutor accordingly. 

If any content in a forum appears to a user to be illegal or dubious, we ask the user to inform us immediately and send an e-mail to the LEO teamIf any content in a forum appears to a user to be illegal or questionable, we ask the user to inform us immediately by sending an email to the LEO team. Please indicate the reason(s) that the contribution is considered to be illegal or at least questionable, so that we can investigate the matter. Please also send us the URL (address of the contribution in question, shown in the browser's address bar), to enable us to locate the contribution.

Sanctions

Completion of the registration process establishes a contractual relationship between LEO and the registered user. LEO is entitled to ban any user or to terminate this contract immediately if the user violates the above terms of use or behaves in such an unacceptable manner that LEO cannot reasonably continue the contract. In addition, LEO can also remove any individual contributions which are in contravention of the terms of use set out above.

In the event of a termination or the blocking of a contract, the user concerned is not permitted to register again with LEO using the same or another login and/or nick without obtaining prior written consent from LEO. 

LEO is entitled, but not obliged, to continue to make use of the contributions posted in a forum by the user in question prior to termination of the contract. Contributions that have been erased may not be re-posted.

Online Courses / General Terms &. Conditions 

If you would like to purchase one of our online courses, please take the time to read our General Terms &. Conditions .

Legal Validity

Only the German version of our Terms of Usage is legally binding.

Further information is to be found on our Privacy Policy Dictionary Navigation
